problem:
For some positive integers $m$ and $n,$
\[\sqrt{23 + \sqrt{28}} + \sqrt{23 - \sqrt{28}} = \sqrt{m + \sqrt{n}}.\]Enter the ordered pair $(m,n).$
model_solution:
Step 1: Let $x=\sqrt{23+\sqrt{28}}+\sqrt{23-\sqrt{28}}.$

Squaring both sides of this equation yields $x^2=23+\sqrt{28}+2\sqrt{(23+\sqrt{28})(23-\sqrt{28})}+23-\sqrt{28}$
Step 2: 
\begin{align*}x^2&=46+2\sqrt{23^2-28} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{529-28} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{501} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{3\cdot167} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{3}\sqrt{167} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{3}\sqrt{167} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{3}\sqrt{167} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{3}\sqrt{167} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{3}\sqrt{167} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{3}\sqrt{167} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{3}\sqrt{167} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{3}\sqrt{167} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{3}\sqrt{167} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{3}\sqrt{167} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{3}\sqrt{167} \\
&=46+2\sqrt{3}\sqrt{167} \\
&=46
\begin{align*}
x^2 &= 46+2\sqrt{3}\sqrt{167} \\
\frac{x^2-46}{2} &= \sqrt{3}\sqrt{167} \\
(\frac{x^2-46}{2})^2 &= 3\cdot 167 \\
x^4-46x^2+4 &= 167\cdot 3 \\
x^4-46x^2-501 &= 0 \\
\end{align*}
\begin{align*}x^4-46x^2-501 &= (x^2-49)(x^2+51) \\
&= (x^2-7^2)(x^2+51) \\
&= (x+7)(x-7)(x^2+51) \\
&= (x+7)(x-7)(x^2+51) 
\end{align*}
\begin{align*}
x^2+51=0 \quad \text{or} \quad x+7=0 \quad \text{or} \quad x-7=0
\end{align*}
$x^2+51=0$ has no real solutions, and $x+7=0$ yields $x=-7$.
\begin{align*}
x-7=0 &\quad\Rightarrow\quad x=7 \\
&\Rightarrow\quad \sqrt{23+\sqrt{28}}+\sqrt{23-\sqrt{28}}=7 \\
&\Rightarrow\quad \sqrt{m+\sqrt{n}}=7 \\
&\Rightarrow\quad m+\sqrt{n}=49\\
&\Rightarrow\quad m+\sqrt{n}=\boxed{49} \\
&\Rightarrow\quad \sqrt{n}=\sqrt{48} \\
&\Rightarrow\quad n=\boxed{48} \\
&\Rightarrow\quad (m,n)=\boxed{(49,48)} \\
\end{align*}
\begin{align*}
x^4-46x^2-501 &= (x^2-49)(x^2+51) \\
&= (x^2-7^2)(x^2+51) \\
&= (x+7)(x-7)(x^2+51) \\
\end{align*}
\begin{align*}
x^2+51=0 \quad \text{or} \quad x+7=0 \quad \text{or} \quad x-7=0
\end{align*}
steps:
Step 1: Let $x=\sqrt{23+\sqrt{28}}+\sqrt{23-\sqrt{28}}.$

Squaring both sides of this equation yields $x^2=23+\sqrt{28}+2\sqrt{(23+\sqrt{28})(23-\sqrt{28})}+23-\sqrt{28}$
$x^2+51=0$ has no real solutions, and $x+7=0$ yields $x=-7$.
full_steps:
Step 1: Let $x=\sqrt{23+\sqrt{28}}+\sqrt{23-\sqrt{28}}.$

Squaring both sides of this equation yields $x^2=23+\sqrt{28}+2\sqrt{(23+\sqrt{28})(23-\sqrt{28})}+23-\sqrt{28}$
$x^2+51=0$ has no real solutions, and $x+7=0$ yields $x=-7$.
